meanings.definition: To attribute concrete existence to something abstract.
meanings.sent1: She hypostatized her dreams into achievable goals.
meanings.sent2: The artist hypostatized his emotions into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The philosopher humorously hypostatized the concept of time as a mischievous trickster.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music was hypostatized as a symphony of colors in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The teacher hypostatized the importance of kindness by turning it into a tangible treasure chest.

meanings.definition: To treat as a concrete reality.
meanings.sent1: He hypostatized his imaginary friend as a real person in his stories.
meanings.sent2: The children hypostatized the cardboard box into a spaceship for their adventure.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully hypostatized the vegetables as a marching band in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The author hypostatized the haunted house into a character with a dark past.
meanings.sent5: The scientist hypostatized the theory into a physical model to demonstrate its validity.
